subject: Sleep
title: Sleep Deprivation as Antidepressant
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Sleep Deprivation as Antidepressant.

hook.text: Stay awake all night and depression lifts temporarily by morning. This isn't a myth. It's replicated science.

buildup.text: Total sleep deprivation improves mood in about 60 percent of depressed patients within 24 hours.

discovery.text: Sleep deprivation increases serotonin and dopamine transmission and resets disrupted circadian signaling.

twist.text: The effect vanishes after recovery sleep. One nap can reverse the entire antidepressant benefit.

climax.text: Clinicians now use controlled wake therapy combined with light therapy to extend the antidepressant effect.

punchline.text: Losing sleep cures depression for a day. Sleeping erases the cure.

quiz.question: What happens to the antidepressant effect of sleep deprivation after recovery sleep?
options: It vanishes, even after just a nap
